description:
The Zscaler Global Partner Marketing team is seeking an experienced marketing professional to lead our Americas Partner Marketing organization. This high impact role will be responsible for developing and executing a strategy focused on driving partner awareness, engagement, and pipeline generation through Zscaler’s ecosystem of partners.

Qualified candidates will have demonstrated success in leadership roles managing high performing teams within a hyper growth environment. Extensive experience in partner ecosystems, co-marketing strategies, planning, budgeting, pipeline generation, and business/marketing metrics and analytics.

Specific Responsibilities
• Develop a comprehensive framework for joint marketing plans with clear objectives, key metrics, and outcomes
• Lead a team of partner marketing managers in the Americas to deliver partner-initiated pipeline and accelerate thru-partner business results
• Collaborate with various marketing, channel, alliance, and enablement stakeholders in developing cross-functional go-to-market strategies
• Partner with Vice President of Americas Channel & Alliances Sales to align marketing and investments to support the organization’s business goals
• Establish a planning and budgeting operating model aligned to Global Partner Marketing
• Build strong relationships with peer executives within Zscaler’s top partners
• Measure and report on key metrics and performance indicators across partner campaigns, investments, and overarching business results
• Build for scale: assess and evolve organizational structure, programs, and operating model to deliver partner marketing success at scale

Qualifications:
• 10 years relevant work experience in partner marketing with b2b technology companies
• Experience across the partner ecosystem including: Solution Providers, GSIs, Technology Alliances, Service Providers, Hyperscalers, Distributors
• Experience leading and building high performing teams
• Demonstrated success in creating robust, integrated partner demand generation campaigns
• Clear understanding of funnel metrics, ROI, targets and analysis, and the ability to affect results across multiple functions
• Strong communication, collaboration, and analytical skills
• Advanced leadership skills
• Flexible and adaptive to rapidly changing environment
• Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well across teams, sales, partners, vendors
• B.S. or B.A. required
